isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: ROCKWELL - LUBRICATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the correct lubricants.

step1.para: All steering universal joints, knuckle bushings or bearings, grease lubricated wheel bearings, drive shaft splines and splines of the outer universal joint shaft ( Figure 39).

The frequency of lubricant changes depends on operating conditions, speed and loads. Change lubricants when seals are replaced, when brakes are relined, at 30,000 miles (48,000 km) or 2000 hours of operation. If mileage is less than 30,000 miles or 2000 hours of operation a year, change two times a year (spring and fall).

caution.para: If the front drive axle is the vehicle's only drive axle, lubricate the universal joints, drive shaft splines and splines of the outer universal joint shaft every 15,000 miles (24,000 km) or 1000 hours of operation.

step1.para: Every 3000 miles (4800 km) or 200 hours of operation.

Every 25,000 to 30,000 miles (40,000 to 48,000 km) or 1600 to 2000 hours of operation when yearly use is more than 60,000 miles (96,500 km). If mileage is less than 60,000 miles, change two times a year (spring and fall).
